p: Cassia nigricans is a herbal plant used to treat various fevers in Nigeria. The methanol extract of the whole plant yielded an antiplasmodial compound, emodin (57), an anthraquinone with an IC 50 of 10.8 μg/mL in chloroquine-resistant P. falciparum strain K1 (Obodozie et al., 2004). In another study 57 was isolated from a methanol stem bark extract of another plant from the same genus, C. siamea, and confirmed to have strong activity against multidrug-resistant P. falciparum K1 strain (IC 50 of 5 μg/mL) (Ajaiyeoba et al., 2008). Such independent confirmation of the activity is obviously important but unfortunately rare, in part because such data are harder to publish.
